paper_abstract: Graphs with large spectral gap are important in various fields such as biology sociology and computer science In designing such graphs an important question is how the probability of graphs with large spectral gap behaves A method based on multicanonical Monte Carlo is introduced to quantify the behavior of this probability which enables us to calculate extreme tails of the distribution The proposed method is successfully applied to random 3-regular graphs and large deviation probability is estimated (C) 2010 Elsevier B V All rights reserved
paper_title: Probability of graphs with large spectral gap by multicanonical Monte Carlo
